definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

sentences.english: The child glanced at his angry father timidly.
sentences.chinese: 孩子怯生生地瞟了一眼怒气冲冲的父亲。

sentences.english: He shot out some angry words.
sentences.chinese: 他迸出几句怒气冲冲的话。

sentences.english: Surrounding the Camaro, a group of pissed-off punks stared down at Jack.
sentences.chinese: 科迈罗车周围，一群小混混怒气冲冲地盯着杰克。

sentences.english: He clapped his hat on angrily and walked out.
sentences.chinese: 他气冲冲地急忙戴上帽子走出去了。

sentences.english: The manager stormed into my office,waving a piece of paper about.
sentences.chinese: 经理怒气冲冲闯进我的办公室，手里挥着一份文件。

sentences.english: He stormed out of the room .
sentences.chinese: 他气冲冲地走出了房间。

sentences.english: "They are a passel of fools" she said shortly.
sentences.chinese: “他们是一群大傻瓜，”她怒气冲冲地说。

sentences.english: Both Mr Watt and Mr Knott were angry and put their telephones down.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生和诺德先生都怒气冲冲地撂下话筒。

sentences.english: The man stormed his way out of the room .
sentences.chinese: 那个人怒气冲冲地闯出了房间。

sentences.english: Treasure discontent less angry, dinner more than with silver paper.
sentences.chinese: 宝少不满怒气冲冲，宴席二人更比并烧银纸。

sentences.english: His foot smashed through the door in a rage.
sentences.chinese: 他怒气冲冲一脚踢破了门。

sentences.english: The purple wreath annoys dull blunt the ground stand get up.
sentences.chinese: 紫环气冲冲地站了起来。

sentences.english: The old man rant that nobody pay any attention to his opinion.
sentences.chinese: 老人怒气冲冲地叫嚷说没人听他的意见。

sentences.english: She stormed out of him and didn't say anything.
sentences.chinese: 她什么话也没说就怒气冲冲地离开了他。

sentences.english: But I didn ‘t say anything and stormed off.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我嘴里什么都没说，气冲冲地走了。

sentences.english: Not even the women? He huffs and waves his hands in protest.
sentences.chinese: 女人也是？他怒气冲冲的挥动着手抗议。

definition: variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
